source.cbdedbbe:
# checking for rows and columns for each 
def rows_n_cols(df):
    rows = df.shape[0]
    cols = df.shape[1]
    print("{} rows and {} columns".format(rows,cols))
source.b2c0cca9:
# issues dataset
print("The issue_df contains the follwing observations ")
rows_n_cols(issues_df)
print("The prs_df contains the follwing observations")
rows_n_cols(prs_df)
print("The repos_df contains the follwing observations")
rows_n_cols(repos_df)
source.ed73533d:
def data_types(df):
    numeric = df.select_dtypes(include=['int64']).columns.tolist()
    categorical = df.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
    print("The numeric columns are \n",numeric )
    print("The categorical columns are \n", categorical)
source.fc0c3342:
print("Issues data set numeric Cols and Categorical Cols")
data_types(issues_df)
print("-------------------------------------------------------------------------")
print("Prs dataset numeric cols and Categorical Columns")
data_types(prs_df)
print("-------------------------------------------------------------------------")
print("Repository dataset numeric cols and Categorical Columns")
data_types(repos_df)

# repository data set data top 10 languages
top_20_language = repos_df.sort_values(by="num_repos", ascending=False)[:20]
plt.figure(figsize=(10,5))
sns.barplot(data=top_20_language, x="num_repos" ,y="language", palette="dark");
source.404cacb8:
# we can also used to visualize by px.histogram
px.histogram(top_20_language,
            x="language",
            y= "num_repos",
            color_discrete_sequence=["Red"],
            title="The distribtion of TOP 20 Programming Repository IN Github")
source.4bba0751:
pd.options.mode.chained_assignment = None 
def adjust_date(df):
    df['date'] = df['year'].astype('str') + '-' + (df['quarter']*3-2).astype('str').str.pad(2,fillchar='0')
    df['date'] = pd.to_datetime(df['date'], format='%Y-%m')
    df.drop(['year','quarter'],axis=1,inplace=True)
    df = df[df.date<'2022-01-01']
    return df
issues_df = adjust_date(issues_df)
prs_df = adjust_date(prs_df)
source.811a58a2:
total = issues_df.groupby(['date']).sum()/1000
plt.figure(figsize=(10,5))
sns.set_theme(style='darkgrid')
ax = sns.lineplot(x='date',y='count',data=total)
ax.axes.set_title('Total Issues Count',fontsize=18)
ax.set_xlabel("Year",fontsize=15)
ax.set_ylabel("Number of Issues (in thousand)",fontsize=15);

# top issue of 10 programming lanagues
top =7
top_7 = issues_df.groupby(['name']).sum().sort_values('count', ascending=False)['count'][:top].index
top_7

top_issues['count'] = top_issues['count']/1000

sns.set_theme(style='darkgrid')
ax = sns.lineplot(x='date',y='count',hue='name',data=top_issues)
ax.axes.set_title(f'Issues of Top {top} Language',fontsize=15)

source.927ac892:
top_prs = prs_df[prs_df.name.isin(top_7)]
top_prs['count'] = top_prs['count']/1000
plt.figure(figsize=(15,10))
sns.set_theme(style='darkgrid')
ax = sns.lineplot(x='date',y='count',hue='name',data=top_prs)
ax.axes.set_title(f'Prs of Top {top} Language',fontsize=20)
ax.set_xlabel("Year",fontsize=12)
ax.set_ylabel("Prs Count (in thousand)",fontsize=12);
